text: Union Minister for Power and New & Renewable Energy chaired the National Conference of Power and Renewable Energy Ministers of States & UTs, emphasizing 24x7 quality electricity supply.
The Union Power & NRE Minister held a two-day Review, Planning and Monitoring Meeting with power sector stakeholders to discuss load shedding and investment strategies.
NTPC Renewable Energy Limited won a 500 MW solar power contract in the SECI auction at a tariff of Rs 3.52 per kWh.
NTPC Renewable Energy Limited will build ESS of 1000 MWh along with the contracted solar capacity as part of the 500 MW SECI auction win.
The government decided to invite bids for 50 GW of renewable energy capacity annually from 2023-24 to 2027-28 to achieve 500 GW of non-fossil capacity by 2030.
India successfully met an all-time maximum power demand of 250 GW during FY 2024-25, demonstrating major progress in electricity infrastructure.
India will stop setting annual clean energy tender targets and move towards demand-based tender issuance for renewable projects.
Maharashtra Electricity Regulatory Commission approved MSEDCL’s plan to procure 780 MW of wind-solar hybrid power from NTPC.
BC Jindal Group secured a 150 MW round-the-clock renewable energy project through an SECI auction.
The Cabinet approved higher green investment limits for NTPC and NLC India to support non-fossil fuel capacity expansion.
Torrent Power ranks first in national utility ratings with 100/100 scores from the Union Ministry of Power criteria.
NF Ministry of Power sought comments on the draft National Electricity Policy 2026 to transform India’s energy framework.
Waaree Renewable Technologies announced entry into grid infrastructure by acquiring a 55% stake in APSL to support renewable deployment.
ACME Group tied up with IPICOL to set up green methanol unit in Odisha to support renewable energy and green hydrogen initiatives.
NTPC hosts its 18th Lenders’ Meet showcasing growth roadmap and green energy vision, engaging financial stakeholders.
NTPC celebrated crossing 85.5 GW+ commercial capacity connecting more renewable projects into the grid.
NTPC inaugurated a solar hydrogen based microgrid at Chushul, expanding decentralized renewable energy adoption.
A review of Inter-State Transmission Plan was conducted focusing on renewable and grid enhancements for future expansion.
India’s solar energy agency SECI plans to bid for state-level projects to reach 10 GW capacity by 2030.
On October 18 2023, MNRE plans construction of a 13,000 MW renewable Green Energy Corridor and battery energy storage projects.
Times of India reported NTPC Green Energy won a 500 MW solar power project and will install ESS to bolster grid reliability.
Maharashtra State Electricity body received recognition for solar rooftop and distribution performance improvements.
Reuters reported India revoking connectivity permissions for 6.3 GW of renewable energy projects due to delayed commissioning.
The Ministry of Power sought comments on new transmission ROW guidelines to improve grid project execution.
NTPC Renewable Energy’s commercial operation certificate granted for 300 MW of its solar PV project at Bhadla.
Reuters reported India’s SECI changed its bidding policy to base most renewable power bids on state demand rather than centralized pool auctions.
The National Conference of Power and Renewable Energy Ministers highlighted the role of states in ensuring uninterrupted power supply.
India’s power sector achieved record peak power demand and reduced shortages in FY 2025-26, signifying strong capacity additions.
Reuters reported India’s Solar Energy Corp plans to finance and operate 1,200 MW of renewable power installations by mid-2026.
NTPC Green Energy arm saw its shares rise after success in green ammonia auctions and commissioning of renewable projects.
